title: Culturally Considerate Mathematics Instructional Design for Australian Indigenous Preservice Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary-level mathematics knowledge and pre-service teacher training experience
context.additional_context: Customized online mathematics education design for Australian Indigenous learners (Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples). Strengthens narrative yarning-based interaction to integrate cultural identity with learning experiences

learning_goals: Learners can explain middle school-level math concepts (e.g., ratios, statistics, geometry) through real-life examples connected to Australian Indigenous culture.
Learners can proactively lead online discussion activities that foster cultural empathy with peer learners and instructors using the Yarning technique.
Learners can mathematically model Indigenous community issues (e.g., land division, resource management) and present culturally contextualized results through project-based assessment tasks.

resources: Audio/Video Tools for Yarning Session Recording
Indigenous Community Resources (Maps, Photographs, Oral History Archives)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
